description: Reviewed and actioned 1000+ grant applications for events and materials for clubs.
Tutored dozens of kids across year 11 and 12 in HSC subjects IPT, Mathematics Advanced, and SDD.
Organised a team of 60 volunteers, hosting fortnightly meetings, training sessions, and internal events.

Hosted the inaugural 'ADA Carnival' with faculty and other society support, which featured a dozen stalls, food vendors, music acts, and was attended by over 2,000 UNSW students and staff. Won 'Best Large Event of The Year'.
Hosted the society's first interfaculty camp which lasted 3 days and orientated 120 first-year ADA students.
Supported the early learning of dozens of children after school and during holiday periods through engaging them in creative activities with me and their peers.
Organised a Model United Nations Debating competition with over 20 rounds at host schools involving 400 students across regional and rural NSW.
Managed an organising committee team of 4 in completion of tasks such as emailing teachers and students, roadtrip logistics, content delivery, and other administrative tasks.
Worked with a chief judge to standardise judging of the competition and train volunteers.
Ran a panel 'The Threat of Information' in 2021 with three experts on the field of disinformation specialising in South East Asia
Was a discussion host on the 'The Role of Women in South East Asia' discussion panel where i moderated discussion with an expert in the field.
